intro: Ruschia mathewsii, commonly known as the Mathews' Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
